SEARCH
Package com.csse3200.game.components.minigames.pool.logic

Interface RuleSet

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicTwoPlayerRules
public interface RuleSet
Defines the contract for all pool rule sets.

A RuleSet manages turn logic, fouls, scoring, and shot state. Implementations handle how the game responds to events such as shots, scratches, and potted balls.

  • Method Details

    • onNewRack

      void onNewRack(BallFactory balls)
      Called when a new rack begins. Resets all balls and cue positions, and prepares internal state.
      Parameters:
      balls - the BallFactory instance managing all pool balls

    • onShoot

      void onShoot(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body cue, float dx, float dy, float power)
      Called when the player takes a shot. Applies the given impulse direction and power to the cue ball.
      Parameters:
      cue - the cue ball body
      dx - x-direction component of the shot
      dy - y-direction component of the shot
      power - shot power in range [0..1]

    • onBallPotted

      void onBallPotted(int ballId, int pocketIndex)
      Called when a ball (object or cue) is potted.
      Parameters:
      ballId - ID of the ball that was potted (0 = cue ball)
      pocketIndex - index of the pocket the ball entered

    • onScratch

      void onScratch(int pocketIndex)
      Called when the cue ball is scratched (potted).
      Parameters:
      pocketIndex - index of the pocket where the cue ball fell

    • updateTurn

      void updateTurn()
      Updates the rule state once per frame. Detects when motion stops and advances turns accordingly.

    • setListener

      void setListener(RulesEvents listener)
      Sets the listener used to notify other systems (UI, host) about turn changes, scoring updates, and fouls.
      Parameters:
      listener - a RulesEvents listener instance

    • isShotActive

      boolean isShotActive()
      Checks whether a shot is currently in progress.
      Returns:
      true if a shot is active, otherwise false
